clinical_study.brief_title: Merck IISP Stewardship Grant for Antibiotic Best Practices
clinical_study.official_title: Implementation of Antimicrobial Stewardship and Decision Support Into the EPIC Electronic Medical Record

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to pilot the use of best practices alerts to enhance an antimicrobial stewardship program using the electronic medical record, EPIC.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to pilot the use of best practices to enhance an antimicrobial stewardship program using the electronic medical record, EPIC. Screening information technology tools via SETNET/Safety SUrveyor(Premier) and the electronic anti-infective order form would allow for sufficient medical record review to create best practices alerts for the purpose of appropriate de-escalation of anti-invectives.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of best practice alerts(BPA) that were completely accepted, partially accepted, or rejected within 72 hours of issuing the BPA
primary_outcome.description: after issuing the BPA for deescalation, the responding healthcare provider will respond in one of the manners above

secondary_outcome.measure: The number and type of antiinfectives that were administered before and after(11days) the best practice alert is issued.
secondary_outcome.description: The antiinfective use before and after the BPA will be analyzed in detail. The number of antibiotics, percentage decrease(or less likely increase) in antiinfectives in the 3 days before BPA , and 11 days after the BPA will be analyzed. A cost analysis will be performed. Patient outcomes will not be assessed.

arm_group.description: Observational for accept, reject, or accept with modification of Best Practice Alers

study_pop.textblock: 1285 consecutive patients issued BPA for de-escalation of antibiotics in EPIC
